intro: Psychotria lourteigiana, commonly known as the Lourteig's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are edible but contain toxic compounds. Psychotria lourteigiana is often found in shaded understory environments and plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for certain wildlife.
